result.markdown: --- title: "Research Data Management Training" knitr: opts_knit: message: false execute: echo: false warning: false --- All PhD candidates who started after January, 2020, are required to attend some form of Data Management training. There are two training options for PhD candidates at Mechanical Engineering: 1. RDM Training for ME PhD students – ME Graduate School Course - Regularly delivered by the Data Steward to cover all ME PhD students - 5.5 - 7 h (depending on collection of personal data) divided into 3 Parts over 6 – 9 months - 1 GS 2. Research Data Management 101 - Central Graduate School Course - Delivered 4 times a year by the TU Delft Library - 16 hours divided in 3 weeks - 1.5 GS For more information about option 2, visit the [website](https://www.tudelft.nl/en/library/research-data-management/r/training-events/training-for-researchers/research-data-management-101) or contact [RDMtraining-lib@tudelft.nl](mailto:RDMtraining-lib@tudelft.nl). ## RDM Training at ME This course is offered by the ME Graduate School to support PhD candidates at the ME faculty with the Research Data Mangement [policy](https://d2k0ddhflgrk1i.cloudfront.net/Library/Themaportalen/RDM/Beleid/2020_3mE_Research_Data_Management_Policy.pdf) requirements. The course consists of lectures with recommendations for data storage, project organisation, and data sharing and archiving. There will also be a practical component where students will get hands-on experience developing a Data Management Plan (DMP) using the [DMPonline](https://dmponline.tudelft.nl) platform. For more information about the course, and for registration, contact {{< var instructor.name >}} at {{< var instructor.email >}}. ## Upcoming schedule ### Part 1 ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |Type |Date |Time |Location |Instructor | |:-------|:----------|:-----------|:------------------|:----------| |Lecture |2025-02-26 |10.00-12.30 |ME Hall E, A-0-710 |Sara | ::: ::: ### Part 3 Registration for sessions is available on [Brightspace]({{< var brightspace.part3 >}}) for those who have completed parts 1 and 2. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` **TBD** ``` ::: ::: ## Training outcomes At the end of the course, you should be familiar with: - The importance of proper data... + management + storage + documentation - Developing your own DMP - Personal data considerations ## Important info The course will take 5.5 - 7 h (depending if your DMP includes collection of personal data) divided into three parts over 6 – 9 months. You will receive 1 GS for completing the training. Certificates will be provided after the sessions, and can be uploaded to [DMA](https://dma.tudelft.nl) (You can choose any of the three categories in DMA). If you need to submit your PhD agreement before following one of these trainings, under the section Other Arrangements – Data Management Plan, depending on the training you will follow, you can indicate one of the following: 1. Data Management Plan Training for 3mE PhD students - You are going to follow Data Management Plan Training for 3mE PhD students delivered by the faculty data steward within the first year of the PhD. - During this training, you will create a DMP in DMPonline and consult the faculty data steward. - After the training, you will discuss your DMP with your PhD supervisor(s). - You will include your DMP in the Go/No Go Decision. 2. Research Data Management 101 - You are going to follow Research Data Management 101 delivered by the TU Delft Library within the first year of the PhD. - During this training, you will create a DMP in DMPonline and consult the trainers, and the faculty data steward if needed. - After the training, you will discuss your DMP with your PhD supervisor(s). - You will include your DMP in the Go/No Go Decision. It is the responsibility of the PhD supervisor(s) to approve the DMP, not the Data Steward. A guide for the PhD supervisors can be found [here](https://d2k0ddhflgrk1i.cloudfront.net/Library/Themaportalen/RDM/5%20Things%20to%20check%20when%20looking%20at%20Data%20Management%20Plans%20%28DMPs%29%20-%20guidance%20for%20supervisors%20-%20FINAL%20VERSION%20%281%29.pdf). ## Important links - [DMPonline (TU Delft)](https://dmponline.tudelft.nl) - Brightspace module for Part 1 (under construction) - [Brightspace module for Part 3]({{< var brightspace.part3 >}}) - [ME faculty policy for data management](https://filelist.tudelft.nl/Library/Themaportalen/RDM/Beleid/2020_3mE_Research_Data_Management_Policy.pdf)
